column4: I can't get crontab to work right. My entry is "* * * * * /home/brian/launchstuff", to try to get it to run every minute for testing, but it doesn't seem to do anything
The file does run properly from the command line, though
is the user allowed to use cron?

Well /var/log/syslog says "fatal: open /etc/postfix/main.cf: No such file or directory" right after it tries to run my crontab entry. Also, is there any way to refresh crontab after you edit it, or does it happen automatically?
That tells me that postfix isn't installed and/or configured correctly, so you cannot see the output of your job (which is normally mailed to the user running the job)
so what sort of setting should I tweak in postfix? Also, what does postfix have to do with crontab? All my file does is open Google.

Cron runs commands for you.  if those commands produce output to STDOUT, then the system by default tries to mail the output to you.  That requires some kind of mail delivery system.  postfix is mail system.
and that error says the main config file for postfix is missing or unreadable, so probably postfix isn't running.
Any tips for how to configure it? I already have it installed and haven't ever configured it, so I don't know why it wouldn't be working
try to 'touch' the /etc/postfix/main.cf and restarting postfix
Well, I got a different error now. http://paste.ubuntu.com/577287/ I ran 'sudo touch /etc/postfix/main.cf' and then 'sudo /etc/init.d/postfix restart'

looks like there isn't enough info in the built-in config to allow postfix to run.  I'd apt-get purge postfix and then re-install it to see if it gives you a default main.cf.  Are there any /etc/postfix/main.*  files?
btw, from the looks of the line "CRON[15104]: (brian) CMD (/home/brian/launchstuff)", I'd say your cron entry is being run.
I don't know what happened to your postfix configs ... unless you picked "No Configuration" during the install :D  remove it, install it again, and pick "Local only" for the configs.
Ah, just installed with no config and was wondering why it was back to the old error message. Reinstalling with local only now
